model_info.description: The thenlper/gte-base is a BERT-based text embedding model developed by Alibaba DAMO Academy, optimized for information retrieval and semantic similarity tasks. It features a 768-dimensional embedding space, 512-token context window, and 0.22 GB model size. Trained on a large-scale corpus of text pairs across diverse domains, it excels in semantic textual similarity (82.3 MTEB score) and classification tasks while maintaining efficiency for practical deployment.
use_cases: Semantic search engines and information retrieval systems
strengths: Excels in semantic textual similarity (82.3 MTEB score) and pair classification (84.57 MTEB score)
Balanced performance-to-size ratio (0.22 GB) with competitive results against larger models
Multi-stage contrastive learning enables strong semantic understanding without specialized prompts
Supports batch processing via Fireworks AI API for efficient deployment
Achieves 62.39 average MTEB score across diverse tasks
limitations: Limited to English text inputs with 512-token context window (BERT constraint)
Long texts are automatically truncated to 512 tokens
May require domain adaptation for highly specialized applications
Lower performance in summarization tasks (31.17 MTEB score)
